greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of solutions to x^3 + y^3 = z^3 mod n.
comment: Equivalently, the number of solutions to x^3 + y^3 + z^3 == 0 (mod n). - _Andrew Howroyd_, Jul 18 2018
link: Chai Wah Wu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (terms n = 1..1000 from Seiichi Manyama)
program: (PARI) a(n)={my(p=Mod(sum(i=0, n-1, x^(i^3%n)), 1-x^n)); polcoeff(lift(p^3), 0)} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Jul 18 2018
results.author: Ahmed Fares (ahmedfares(AT)my-deja.com), Jul 25 2001
